requirement_title: Implement and Maintain a Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
requirement: The organization should implement and maintain a BCMS that develops business continuity appropriate to the impact of disruptions.
requirement_description: The BCMS should be tailored to the organization's needs, legal requirements, products, processes, size, structure, and interested parties.

controls.control: Conduct a thorough analysis to identify critical business functions, assets, and dependencies that would be impacted by disruptions.
Create a clear governance structure for the BCMS, including roles, responsibilities, and reporting lines.
Develop strategies to maintain business operations during disruptions, such as alternative work locations, remote access, or outsourcing.
Regularly update and maintain documentation of the BCMS, including policies, procedures, plans, and training materials.

requirement_title: Establish Business Continuity Policies and Objectives
requirement: The organization should understand its needs and establish business continuity policies and objectives.
requirement_description: The organization should define its business continuity goals based on the potential impact of disruptions.

controls.control: Regularly assess the potential impact of various threats on critical business processes, systems, and data to prioritize resources for continuity planning.
Define specific goals for recovery time objectives (RTO), recovery point objectives (RPO), and maximum acceptable downtime to guide the development of business continuity plans.
Outline strategies for maintaining critical business functions during disruptions, including alternative methods for delivering products or services and communication with stakeholders.
Create formal policies that outline the organization's approach to business continuity management, including roles, responsibilities, and procedures.

requirement_title: Operate and Maintain Processes, Capabilities, and Response Structures
requirement: The organization should operate and maintain processes, capabilities, and response structures to ensure survival during disruptions.
requirement_description: The organization should have mechanisms in place to respond effectively to disruptions.

controls.control: Create a comprehensive plan outlining the organization's response to various disruptions, including recovery strategies and key personnel roles.
Maintain an off-site location with essential infrastructure and resources to ensure continuity of operations during a major disruption.

controls.control_title: Implement Regular Backup and Offsite Storage
controls.control: Regularly backup critical data and store off-site to minimize data loss during disruptions.
Periodically test the business continuity plan through simulated disruptions to ensure effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.

requirement_title: Monitor and Review BCMS Performance and Effectiveness
requirement: The organization should monitor and review the performance and effectiveness of the BCMS.
requirement_description: The organization should assess the efficiency and efficacy of its BCMS to ensure it meets its objectives.

controls.control: Establish a process to regularly monitor the performance of the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) to ensure it is functioning effectively and efficiently.
Conduct periodic reviews to assess the effectiveness of the BCMS in achieving its intended objectives, such as minimizing downtime and ensuring business continuity.

controls.control_title: Document BCMS Performance and Effectiveness Findings
controls.control: Maintain records of performance and effectiveness reviews to track improvements over time, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions about BCMS enhancements.

requirement_title: Continual Improvement Based on Qualitative and Quantitative Measures
requirement: The organization should continuously improve based on qualitative and quantitative measures.
requirement_description: The organization should strive for continuous improvement in its BCMS.

controls.control: Develop, document, and implement a formal program to continuously evaluate and improve organizational performance based on both qualitative (e.g., customer feedback) and quantitative (e.g., key performance indicators) measures.
Conduct periodic reviews of organizational performance, identifying areas for improvement and setting targets for future performance.
Create a system for customers and employees to provide feedback on products, services, and processes, using this information to drive improvements.

requirement: A BCMS includes a policy, competent people with defined responsibilities, management processes, documented information supporting operational control, and performance evaluation.
requirement_description: The BCMS should have a clear structure with defined components to ensure effective operation.

controls.control: Develop, document, and communicate a Business Continuity Management System policy that outlines the organization's approach to managing risks and ensuring business continuity.
Define roles and responsibilities for individuals involved in the BCMS, including a BCMS Manager, Business Impact Analysts, and Test Managers.
Create documented processes that outline how the organization will identify, assess, manage, respond to, and recover from business disruptions.
Maintain up-to-date documentation of the BCMS, including policies, procedures, plans, and records of tests and exercises.
Regularly review and evaluate the effectiveness of the BCMS to ensure it remains fit for purpose and is continually improved.

requirement: The BCMS should have a policy.
requirement_description: The organization should have a written policy outlining its approach to business continuity.

controls.control: Create a comprehensive policy document outlining the purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, and procedures for the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
Define a clear approval process for the BCMS policy document, involving key stakeholders and ensuring that all necessary parties have reviewed and approved the policy
Provide training to relevant staff members on the BCMS policy document, ensuring they understand their roles and responsibilities in maintaining business continuity
Establish a regular review schedule for the BCMS policy document to ensure its continued relevance and effectiveness, and make necessary updates as required

requirement: The BCMS should have competent people with defined responsibilities.
requirement_description: The organization should assign roles and responsibilities for managing business continuity.

controls.control: Clearly outline the roles, responsibilities, and authorities of each individual involved in the BCMS. This includes identifying a BCMS owner, coordinator, team members, and any other relevant positions.
Develop and implement a comprehensive training program to ensure that all personnel involved in the BCMS are competent and aware of their roles, responsibilities, and the BCMS procedures.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update BCMS Personnel
controls.control: Periodically review the personnel involved in the BCMS to ensure they still meet the competency requirements. Update roles, responsibilities, or authorities as necessary.

Maintain up-to-date documentation of all personnel involved in the BCMS, including their roles, responsibilities, and contact information. This will facilitate effective communication and coordination during incidents.

requirement: The BCMS should have management processes for policy, planning, implementation and operation, performance assessment, management review, and continual improvement.
requirement_description: The organization should have defined processes for managing its business continuity.

controls.control: Develop, document, communicate, and maintain a comprehensive Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) policy that outlines the organization's approach to managing risks and ensuring business continuity.
Develop, document, communicate, and maintain a detailed Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) plan that outlines the steps to be taken in the event of a disruption.
Develop, document, communicate, and maintain detailed procedures for each step outlined in the BCMS plan.
Define roles and responsibilities for BCMS management, including a BCMS team, BCMS coordinator, and BCMS champion.
Provide training to all relevant personnel on their roles and responsibilities in the BCMS, as well as any necessary technical skills.
Regularly test the BCMS plan and procedures to ensure they are effective and up-to-date.
Regularly review the performance of the BCMS, identifying areas for improvement and implementing changes as necessary.
Establish a process for ongoing evaluation, improvement, and updating of the BCMS to ensure it remains effective in managing risks and ensuring business continuity.

requirement: The BCMS should have documented information supporting operational control and performance evaluation.
requirement_description: The organization should maintain records to support the operation of its BCMS and for evaluating its performance.

controls.control: Develop, maintain, and update a comprehensive documentation of the BCMS, including operational procedures, performance metrics, and evaluation methods.
Create a framework for evaluating the effectiveness and efficiency of the BCMS, including key performance indicators (KPIs) and regular review schedules.
Create detailed documentation for each operational control within the BCMS, including steps, responsibilities, and expected outcomes.
